snippet: The move into Tal Shehab is the latest step in a sweeping military campaign seeking to wipe out the opposition and raises fears that tens of thousands of refugees who have been fleeing across the border may be cut off.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; Scott Sayare from Cairo; and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The move into Tal Shehab is the latest step in a sweeping military campaign seeking to wipe out the opposition and raises fears that tens of thousands of refugees who have been fleeing across the border may be cut off.

headline.seo: Syrian Army Attacks Village Near Jordanian Border
headline.main: Syrian Army Attacks Village Near Jordanian Border
headline.print_headline: Syrian Army Attacks Village Near Jordanian Border
